results.byline: By Michael Gold and Grace Ashford
results.title: George Santos Admits to Lying About College and Work History
results.abstract: The congressman-elect confirmed The New York Times’s findings that he had not graduated from college or worked at two major Wall Street firms, as he had claimed.

media.caption: Congressman-Elect George Santos at the Republican Jewish Coalition in Las Vegas in November.
media.copyright: Mikayla Whitmore for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Travel and Vacations;Snow and Snowstorms;Christmas;internal-sub-only;South Korea;Buffalo (NY);Niagara Falls (NY)
results.title: They Traveled From South Korea. They Got Stranded Near Buffalo.
results.abstract: A South Korean tour group’s van became stuck in the snow outside a house in Williamsville, N.Y. They spent the weekend with the residents — who luckily had a well-stocked kitchen.

media.caption: Alexander Campagna, a dentist, and his wife, Andrea, a nurse practitioner, hosted 10 stranded South Korean visitors who were in a tour group headed to Niagara Falls.

results.adx_keywords: Immigration and Emigration;Illegal Immigration;Buses;United States Politics and Government;Christmas;Cold and Cold Spells;Abbott, Gregory W (1957- );Biden, Joseph R Jr;Harris, Kamala D;Migrant Solidarity Mutual Aid Network;Washington (DC);Texas
results.title: Buses of Migrants Arrive at Kamala Harris’s Home on Christmas Eve
results.abstract: About 130 migrants from Texas were bused to the vice president’s home on one of the coldest Christmas Eves on record in the nation’s capital.

media.caption: Volunteers had anticipated three buses with about 130 immigrants to arrive in New York on Christmas Day, but the buses were rerouted to the vice president’s residence.

results.adx_keywords: Power Failures and Blackouts;Snow and Snowstorms;Deaths (Fatalities);Buffalo (NY)
results.byline: By Michael D. Regan, Michael Gold and Mihir Zaveri
results.title: 28 Dead in ‘Once in a Generation’ Blizzard in Western New York
results.abstract: Thousands remain without power in the Buffalo region, where there is as much as 49 inches of snow on the ground, with more still falling.

media.caption: As the storm lingered in Buffalo, some residents emerged from their homes in search of supplies.
media.copyright: Brendan Bannon for The New York Times

results.title: Thousands of Canceled Flights Cap Holiday Weekend of Travel Nightmares
results.abstract: Southwest Airlines, which canceled about 70 percent of its flights, was the airline most affected on Monday.

media.caption: A Southwest Airlines plane parked at Dallas Love Field Airport last week.

results.title: The Last Holdouts

results.title: An Old Medicine Grows New Hair for Pennies a Day, Doctors Say
results.abstract: Dermatologists who specialize in hair loss say that the key ingredient in a topical treatment worked even better when taken orally at a low dose.

media.caption: Brandy Gray, 44, was seen by Dr. Crystal Aguh before and after treatment with oral minoxidil.
media.copyright: Crystal Aguh/Johns Hopkins School of Medicine

results.title: One Final Twist in the Rev. Louis Gigante’s Colorful Life: A Son
results.abstract: Father Gigante, a towering figure in the Bronx, left a $7 million fortune entirely to the son he had while he was a priest.

media.caption: Gino Gigante, whose father was the Rev. Louis Gigante, now runs a video game cafe in Manhattan.
media.copyright: Gregg Vigliotti for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Television;Netflix Inc;Paris (France)
results.title: Emily Is Still in Paris. Why Are We Still Watching?
results.abstract: The Netflix hit has been widely mocked from the beginning. But despite its flaws — or perhaps because of them — it’s a pop-culture phenomenon.

results.title: Democrats, Feeling New Strength, Plan to Go on Offense on Voting Rights
results.abstract: After retaining most of the governor’s offices they hold and capturing the legislatures in Michigan and Minnesota, Democrats are putting forward a long list of proposals to expand voting access.

media.caption: In Michigan, where Gov. Gretchen Whitmer won re-election and Democrats took control of the Legislature, Ms. Whitmer is considering backing automatic voter registration.
media.copyright: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times

results.title: Conservatives in Western Canada Pass Law Rejecting Federal Sovereignty
results.abstract: A new law in the province of Alberta radically circumscribes federal authority, advancing the agenda of the province’s far-right secessionist movement.

media.caption: Near Coutts, Alberta, in August. The province has long held grievances toward the federal government.
media.copyright: Amber Bracken for The New York Times

results.title: In the Bahamas, a Lingering Sympathy for Sam Bankman-Fried
results.abstract: Residents there have a generous view of the disgraced FTX founder, who has been accused of misusing billions of dollars in customer funds.

media.copyright: Eva Marie Uzcategui for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Defense and Military Forces;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Espionage and Intelligence Services;Putin, Vladimir V;Kherson (Ukraine);Russia;Ukraine
results.title: How Citizen Spies Foiled Putin’s Grand Plan for One Ukrainian City
results.abstract: A partisan cell in Kherson spied on, undermined and even hunted down Russian soldiers. Now that Vladimir V. Putin’s forces are gone, people feel free to talk — and to brag a little.

media.caption: Oksana and Dmytro Yevminov aboard their yacht in Kherson, southern Ukraine, last month. They hid guns and sacks of grenades for resistance fighters during the Russian occupation of the city.
media.copyright: Finbarr O’Reilly for The New York Times

results.title: The Mysterious Case of the Doctor Who Disappeared at Sea
results.abstract: Dr. Marvin Moy was facing federal prosecution and a bitter divorce, and his life had been in limbo for months. Some immediately wondered if what looked like a boat crash was actually something else.

media.copyright: Rick Wenner for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Natural Gas;Sabotage (Crime);Pipelines;European Union;Nord Stream AG;Baltic Sea;Germany;Russia;Sweden
results.byline: By Rebecca R. Ruiz and Justin Scheck
results.title: In Nord Stream Mystery, Baltic Seabed Provides a Nearly Ideal Crime Scene
results.abstract: As investigators piece together clues, Russia has quietly taken steps to begin expensive repairs on the giant gas pipeline, complicating theories about who was behind September’s sabotage.

media.caption: A section of the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline in Lubmin, Germany. Much of the European Union and the United States — under both President Barack Obama and President Donald J. Trump — opposed the pipeline’s construction.
media.copyright: Laetitia Vancon for The New York Times

results.title: In Buffalo, Even the Rescuers Needed Rescuing

results.title: With ‘Zero Covid,’ China Proved It’s Good at Control. Governance Is Harder.
results.abstract: For a powerful government that has bragged about its command of the country, its absence at a moment of crisis has made the public question its credibility.

results.title: In Memphis, the Phonics Movement Comes to High School
results.abstract: Literacy lessons are embedded in every academic class. Even in biology.
